Title: Fall 2023 - 03 Product Release Notes
Body__c:
Introduction

This article introduces the new features, enhancements, and fixes available with this release. 

Contents

  • Product Updates
  • Support Services
  • Release Resources

Product Updates

Click a feature link for more information. 

Notes: 

  • For fixes, nCino administrators can click the Product Development Issue (PDI) link to see the Known Issues entry for the PDI. Known Issue details can help you determine if the issue affects your financial institution (FI) and help you plan release testing, if necessary.
    Note: Your FI's Community Administrator controls access to the Known Issues page.
  • For the latest Portfolio Analytics releases, refer to "Portfolio Analytics Release Notes Hub."​
  • For the latest integrations releases, refer to "Integrations: Monthly Release Notes 2024."

Accessibility—Global  

    Applies to: Commercial, Consumer, Small Business, Mortgage UK

    Enhancement: As we continuously work to optimize the customer experience with Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.1, Level AA standards, we are proud to announce an increase in accessibility across feature functionality.

    Our Accessibility and Design teams have made multiple user interface enhancements to features to continue our WCAG compliance journey for the Fall 2023 - 03 release. These features include: 

    • Credit Analysis
    • E-Tran
    • New Loan Creation
    • User Interface

    For more information, refer to “Accessibility Release Notes.” For quick links to impacted documentation, refer to “Welcome to the Accessibility Documentation Experience.”

    < Back to feature table
     

    Automated Spreading—Global  

      Applies to: Commercial, Small Business

      Enhancement: Automated Spreading's machine learning model now uses an improved method to identify the page classifications for financial statements.

      For more information, refer to “February 2024 Automated Spreading Off-Cycle Release Notes” and the Page Classification section of “Getting Started with Automated Spreading.” 

      < Back to feature table

       

      Collateral Management—Global  

      Applies to: Commercial, Consumer, Small Business

      Fixes:

      • Users can now update a currency field from a value to a null (blank) value, and the Collateral list view page saves the null (blank) value correctly. (PDI-15102)
      • On the Edit Collateral screen, users can enter values with data type Percent, Date, or Number, and the system correctly saves the value. (PDI-15035)
      • Users can now select checkboxes on the Pledge Collateral Screen and submit without triggering the “[Name of Field]: Value not of required type” error. (PDI-15799)
      • In the Collateral on Relationship workflow, collateral correctly displays on relationships even when associated Collateral Management records have the Other Property Details field populated. (PDI-15025)

      < Back to feature table
       

      Commercial Pricing and Profitability—Global  

      Applies to: Commercial, Small Business

      Fix: The system displays API values for the Risk Grade field on the Pricing Option record as expected. (PDI-15498)

      Enhancement: Aggregate Profitability View

      • Users can now access an Aggregate Profitability View. This view contains profitability components in one convenient card for optimal visibility and value.
      • Administrators can configure which profitability components to display on their Aggregate Profitability View card. For example, you can add the Profitability card to your Aggregate Profitability View.
        Note: The Aggregate Profitability View card is designed to contain multiple profitability components. There is currently one Profitability card (released in Fall 2023 - 02) available to add to the Aggregate Profitability View card. More profitability components will be available in future releases. 

      For more information, refer to "How to Configure Commercial Pricing and Profitability Administration - PART TWO."

      < Back to feature table
       

      Covenant Management—Global 

      Applies to: Commercial, Small Business

      Fix: For Covenant Servicing, after a Document Manager placeholder associated with a covenant is approved, the system generates a new Smart Checklist requirement linked to a new Document Manager placeholder. This maintains the connection from covenant compliance records to Document Manager placeholders. (PDI-15744)

      < Back to feature table
       

      Credit Analysis: Commercial Real Estate (CRE) Analysis—Global 

      Applies to: Commercial, Small Business

      Fix: Users can now select periods within the Scenarios drop-down when multiple periods exist in Sensitivity Analysis. (PDI-15546)

      < Back to feature table

       

      Credit Memo—Global  

      Applies to: Commercial, Small Business

      Fixes:

      • Users are now able to generate credit memos without Read permissions on the Page Width (nFORMS__Page_Width__c) and Page Dimension Unit (nFORMS__Page_Dimension_Unit__c) fields. (PDI-15730)
      • In narrative fields, the cursor is visible in white spaces. (PDI-15184)
      • nCino supports both new and existing custom CSS styling in the HTML source code editor. nCino restored the ability to write and edit custom CSS in the HTML source code editor after a vendor-side update removed the ability in the Fall 2023 - 02 release. (PDI-15807)

      < Back to feature table
       

      Customer Engagement—Global  

      Applies to: Commercial, Consumer, Small Business

      Fixes: 

      • When you configure the new CLDR Date/Time Format system property, the system now displays input forms correctly for Customer Portal users whose locale is in English (Hong Kong SAR China) (en-HK). For steps on how to configure the system property, refer to "How to Configure User Interface Internationalization." (PDI-14744)
      • nCino updated the Underscore.js library to version 1.13.6 for the Portal package. (PDI-151050).
      • Applicants no longer encounter an error when they select a picklist value that contains more than 40 characters. The maximum character limit is now increased to 255 characters. (PDI-15484)

      < Back to feature table
       

      Deal Proposal—Global   

      Applies to: Commercial, Small Business

      Fix: nCino created a feature and feature process for Deal Proposal in Feature Management. If your institution has Deal Proposal configured, administrators must enable the Deal Proposal feature and run the Update Deal Proposal Source Feature feature process to automatically set Deal Proposal as the source feature on field maps after installation. This is a required upgrade step that can be completed at any time prior to the Spring 2024 - 01 (April) release. 

      Notes:

      • Customers who configure Deal Proposal for the first time do not need to run the Update Deal Proposal Source Feature feature process, as the source feature can be set during initial field mapping configuration.
      • Customers who do not use pipeline object configuration or field mapping do not need to run the Update Deal Proposal Source Feature feature process. 

      < Back to feature table
       

      Deposit Account Opening—US

      Applies to: Commercial, Consumer, Small Business

      Fix: When all products of a product type are set to Exclude From Products, the system no longer displays the product type as a picklist value. (PDI-15115)

      < Back to feature table
       

      Disbursements—US

      Applies to: Consumer

      Fix: The system now saves Related Dates on the Disbursements route as expected. (PDI-15470)

      < Back to feature table
       

      E-Tran Portal—US 

      Applies to: Small Business

      Enhancements:

      • There is a new checkbox field, Includes Non Compete, on the Use of Proceeds object. By default, this field value is false.
      • nCino updated mappings to support Terms and Conditions generation. New data points and mappings include:
        • Extended mappings to account for all Use of Proceeds types
        • Loan Payment Frequency
        • New Calendar Basis Codes:
          • 30_360
          • Actual_365
          • Actual_360
          • 30_365

      For more information and the updated mapping file, refer to “Small Business Administration: nCino E-Tran Portal (US) Integration Getting Started Guide."

      < Back to feature table
       

      Entity Involvement—Global 

      Applies to: Commercial, Consumer, Small Business

      Fix: The system no longer displays additional code in the validation rule error message on an Entity Involvement. (PDI-13510)

      ​< Back to feature table
       

      Environment, Social, and Governance (ESG)—Global  

      Applies to: Commercial, Small Business

      Enhancements:

      • Users can now modify the number of decimal places for scores in the Scores UI.
      • Users can see an overview for the primary ESG assessment, which appears on the ESG tab for Collateral, Customer, and Loan records. Currently, it displays the overall score as well as the total and average score for each category. This overview is available on installation.

      For more information, refer to “How to Use ESG.“

      < Back to feature table
       

      Fee Management—Global 

      Applies to: Commercial, Consumer, Small Business, Treasury Management, Mortgage UK

      Fixes:​

      Updated Fees user interface now works as expected, with the following functionality:

      • An accessibility-focused experience now meets Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.2 Standards.
      • Users can enjoy an easier-to-navigate user interface. 
      • For current users of Enhanced Fee Management, the Fee Management feature process installs the system properties on install. 
      • Administrators can use new system properties to customize the new experience. 
      • The system now displays percentage-based fees correctly on the Loan user interface and fee records. (PDI-15491)
      • Administrators can now edit the standard fees field set in the Add Fee pop-out. (PDI-15004)

      For more information, see “How to Use Fee Management for Commercial, Retail, and Small Business Loans” and “How to Configure Fee Management.”

      < Back to feature table
       

      Form Generation—Global 

      Applies to: Commercial, Consumer, Small Business, Treasury Management, Mortgage UK

      Fix: nCino supports both new and existing custom CSS styling in the HTML source code editor. nCino restored the ability to write and edit custom CSS in the HTML source code editor after a vendor-side update removed the ability in the Fall 2023 - 02 release. (PDI-15807)

      < Back to feature table
       

      Matrix Manager—Global 

      Applies to: Commercial, Consumer, Small Business, Treasury Management, Mortgage UK

      Enhancement: Users can now activate a matrix within Matrix Builder after they upload a matrix file. When a matrix is active, users can upload and download the matrix, and update the result column values. To make changes to the dimensions and dimension values, they must deactivate the matrix and then make the changes. This button is available on the Matrix Builder UI on installation. For more information, refer to "How to Use Matrix Manager Administration" and “How to Configure Matrix Manager.”

      The matrix manager tool supports the following features: 

      • Auto-Applied Fees
      • Auto-Applied Collateral Advance Rates
      • Commercial Pricing and Profitability
      • Retail Pricing (Early Adopter). 

      < Back to feature table
       

      Mortgage UK 

      Applies to: Mortgage UK

      Enhancements:

      • The Affordability Summary page now shows the calculation outcome as Accept, Refer, or Decline. Previously it was Pass, Review, or Declined.
      • In response to enhancement request (PDI-13369), when users open the Self-Employed Income tab but there are no self-employed income entries, we have added messaging to guide the user on how to add new self-employed income entries. 

      Mortgage Servicing Enhancements:

      • Mortgage product packages on the Mortgage Servicing tab now show the total Loan to Value (LTV) for all loans in booked stage. 
      • When a relationship does not have a mortgage application, the Mortgage Servicing tab now informs the user that they must add a mortgage for the relationship before using mortgage servicing.  

      For more information, refer to "Mortgage (UK) Servicing Overview" and "Mortgage (UK) Servicing Configuration" (internal- and partner-only). 

      < Back to feature table
       

      New Loan Creation—Global 

      Applies to: Commercial, Consumer, Small Business, Mortgage UK

      Fix: In support of our continued dedication to accessibility, nCino added keyboard access and removed menu icon access to print chart options from the loan stage history UI. Previously, users could not access the menu using keyboard, and it appeared only in the collapsed dashboard view. (PDI-12734) 

      For success criteria and images, refer to “Accessibility Release Notes.”

      < Back to feature table
       

      nCino's Document Generation—Global 

      Applies to: Commercial, Consumer, Small Business, Treasury Management, Mortgage UK

      Fixes:

      • When administrators create an HTML form template with a PDF document output, the document now displays both single-byte and double-byte characters (for example, Japanese characters). Minor configuration is required to implement this fix. Administrators must highlight the text and then clear formatting on their templates. Refer to "How to Configure nCino’s Document Generation." (PDI-14738) 
      • nCino supports both new and existing custom CSS styling in the HTML source code editor. nCino restored the ability to write and edit custom CSS in the HTML source code editor after a vendor-side update removed the ability in the Fall 2023 - 02 release. (PDI-15807)

      < Back to feature table
       

      Priority Manager—Global 

      Applies to: Commercial, Consumer, Small Business, Treasury Management, Mortgage UK

      Fix: When the administrator runs the Create Sample Tabs feature process, the system creates the Origination and Documents tabs as expected.

      Enhancements:

      Priority Manager improves the configuration experience by providing the administrator with more configuration options within Priority Manager. These improvements include the ability to:

      • Create a new view when there are views present
      • Delete a tab or view 
      • Edit a view name
      • Lock List Filters to prevent edits

      For more information, refer to “How to Use Priority Manager” and “How to Configure Priority Manager.”

      < Back to feature table
       

      Rate & Payment Structures—Global 

      Applies to: Commercial, Small Business, Mortgage UK

      Fixes:

      • Custom monthly interest rates are now respected in amortization calculations as expected. (PDI-15782)
      • Updated Rate and Payment now works as expected, with the following functionality:
        • Rate and Payment now includes financed fees and Annual Percentage Rate (APR) in amortization calculations.  
        • For current users of Enhanced Fee Management, the Fee Management and Register Fee Services feature processes run on install to enable financed fee calculations within Rate and Payment.  
        • Administrators can configure financed fees in Fee Management and Auto-Applied Fees and use those fees in rate and payment calculations.
        • Field set driven functionality results in minimal administrator configuration.
        • Note: This functionality is not yet supported with Wolters Kluwer Document Preparation.  

      ​For more information, refer to “How to Use Fee Management for Commercial, Retail, and Small Business Loans” and "How to Configure Rate and Payment Structures."

      < Back to feature table
       

      Risk Rating—Global   

      Applies to: Commercial, Small Business

      Fix: Users no longer encounter issues when they click the Save button before the Calculate button on the Risk Rating Worksheet. (PDI-11632)

      Enhancement: Users can now calculate and save values on the Risk Rating Worksheet using the combined Calculate and Save button. This new combined button is available on installation. ​For more information, refer to "How to Use Risk Rating."

      < Back to feature table
       

      Smart Checklist—Global 

      Applies to: Commercial, Consumer, Small Business, Treasury Management, Mortgage UK

      Fixes: 

      • The Assign to Me button works as expected. When a user clicks Assign to Me, the user interface shows the requirement is assigned to the user. (PDI-15812)
      • Hard Stop configuration no longer prevents fee record insertion from Commercial Pricing and Profitability (CPP). (PDI-15529)

      < Back to feature table
       

      Treasury Management—US 

      Applies to: Treasury Management

      Fix: The system now correctly displays the default field value on the Mass Add pop-up window. (PDI-10082)

      Enhancement: Users can filter the Change Summary for blank entries using two dashes (“--”) in the Value filter field. Current users can filter if administrators have selected the Enable Filering checkbox. For more information, refer to “How to Use Treasury Management” and “How to Configure Treasury Management: Treasury Maintenance."

      < Back to feature table
       

      User Interface—Global  

      Applies to: Commercial, Consumer, Small Business, Treasury Management, Mortgage UK

      Fix: When you configure the new Unicode Common Locale Data Repository (CLDR) Date/Time Format system property, the system now displays the dates in the CLDR unicode format for the respective user locale. For steps on how to configure the system property, refer to "How to Configure User Interface: Internationalization.”  (PDI-14797)

      < Back to feature table

       

      Support Services

      Proactive Case Enhancement

      In response to your feedback, Support introduces the ability to designate one administrator at your FI to be the default contact for release and proactive cases. Going forward, all FIs must now have one default proactive case administrator assigned. With this update, nCino designated the most recently logged in administrator as the default contact for proactive cases. Review this selection and update as necessary. 

      Follow these steps to assign a different administrator as the default contact:

      1. Navigate to the User Management tab in Community.
      2. Click Edit next to the administrator you want to be the default contact.
      3. Select Proactive Case Admin checkbox.

       

      Release Resources 

      Use the following documentation to successfully adopt the latest release:
